subtitle: hi I'm Simon Jacobsen welcome to
meaningful Monday's where we answer your
personal questions the question for this
week is I don't think that therapy is
working for me I've been paying
therapists for ten years and I still
have my issues what is wrong with me I'm
starting to think my depression and
negativity can't be helped by therapy
well let me begin with a joke there was
this guy who had fear of going to sleep
at night he had dreams and fantasies of
demons and witches and goblins under his
bed as soon as he would go to sleep he'd
begin to think about it and so simply
could not fall asleep
he went to seek out a therapist finally
found a psychiatrist he began seeing the
psychiatrist suggested we're gonna have
to have many sessions started digging
for solutions going into his childhood
and his past and his father's child of
his grandfather's childhood you can
imagine and began this weekly ritual of
going to psychotherapy and nothing being
resolved he still can't sleep and
several months later this fellow goes to
see his rabbi throws his rabbi I barely
could sleep I'm so tired
said rabbi say what's the problem he
says I can't sleep at night because of
this fear of these demons and what is
there psychotherapist says there's
nothing go every week I talk about it
doesn't help so the rabbi gives him a
suggestion from that night on he was
able to sleep peaceful stops going to
obviously to the psychotherapy where it
was also draining his pocketbook one day
he meets a psychiatrist in the street
the psychiatrist says what happened to
you you need a lot more work you said
well I found a solution I sleep
peacefully answer how did you find a
solution
he says it was also free my solution I
went to my rabbi and he told me to do
something that solved the problem what
did he tell you to do he said to cut off
the legs of my bed she no longer had
fears because nothing could crawl under
the bed that has no legs if therapy is
not working then maybe that's not the
right way to go they
is the wrong therapist and maybe your
problem is not really one based on that
so you have to think different if you
keep thinking the same way you're gonna
have the same results if to find
different solutions
generally speaking depression is not
something you can just fight just like
you can't fight darkness with a weapon
you can't start shooting a darkness
depression is not something you can
eliminate with a tool you'd eliminate
depression just like you eliminate
darkness with light light is the
response to darkness joy is a response
to depression
so people say it can't be joyous because
I'm depressed but maybe if you were joy
she wouldn't be depressed you have to
get yourself into environments that are
upbeat and people that are upbeat and
find ways to bring some light into your
life it may require starting a new hobby
finding a new friend starting a new
class to dwell on your depression and
can't will only make you more depressed
and especially recognizing that you're
not finding any solutions introduce
something new to your life introduce a
new activity new light and light by
nature has the power to dispel darkness
thank you for watching I invite your
